Module execute
Package org.zuky.dialogs

Class FileDialog

java.lang.Object
org.zuky.dialogs.FileDialog
public class FileDialog extends Object
Allows single and multiple selection of files and folders in the dialog box. It also allows a more precise search by specifying a search filter by calling the setFilter(String[]) method.
See Also:
  • Open and Save As dialog boxes - Win32

    • getAbsolutePath

      public String getAbsolutePath()
      Returns the path to the selected file or folder. If nothing has been selected yet the method returns null. If you set a multiple selection you must call getSelectedFiles()
      Returns:
      absolute path
      See Also:
      • setMultiSelected(boolean)
      • getSelectedFiles()

    • getSelectedFiles

      public String[] getSelectedFiles()
      Returns an array with the selected files. First of all you must activate the multiple selection by calling setMultiSelected(boolean).

      If no files or folders were selected, the method returns null.

      Returns:
      selected files
      See Also:
      • getAbsolutePath()
      • setMultiSelected(boolean)

    • getFilter

      public String[] getFilter()
      Returns an array representing the file filter. If no filter is specified the method returns null.
      Returns:
      filter
      See Also:
      • setFilter(String[])

    • setFilter

      public void setFilter(String[] filter)
      Allows you to add a file filter in the dialog box.

      Every file matching the extension you specified in the filter will be visible in the dialog box.

      The array must be formed first with a description of the extension and then of the extension, which means that the first element of the array is the description and the second element is the extension and so on with the third element being the description and the fourth element the extension. This means that the length of the array must be divisible by 2, if this is not the case the method will throw an exception of type IllegalArgumentException, also no element must be null. 

              setFilter(new String[] {
            "Text file (*.txt)", "*.txt",
            "Image file (*.jpg *.png)", "*.jpg;*.png",
            "All Files", "*.*"
        });
      Parameters:
      filter - file filter
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - The array is not correct
      NullPointerException - An array element is null
      See Also:
      • getFilter()

    • getFilterIndex

      public int getFilterIndex()
      Returns the index of the priority filter.
      Returns:
      filter index
      See Also:
      • setFilterIndex(int)

    • setFilterIndex

      public void setFilterIndex(int filterIndex)
      Tells the dialog box to prioritize a specific filter using the index.

      The index cannot be a negative number or greater than the index of the array entered from the setFilter(String[]) method, if that is the case an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

      Parameters:
      filterIndex - filter index

    • setMultiSelected

      public void setMultiSelected(boolean multi)
      Enables the multiple selection option

      If this option is enabled, you must call method getSelectedFiles() after the dialog box has ended.

      Parameters:
      multi - multi file selection
      See Also:
      • isMultiSelected()

    • isMultiSelected

      public boolean isMultiSelected()
      Returns a boolean value indicating whether multiple selection is enabled in the dialog box.
      Returns:
      is multi selected
      See Also:
      • setMultiSelected(boolean)

    • setSelectedFolders

      public void setSelectedFolders(boolean selectedFolders)
      Allows you to select folders in the system.

      This option is only available from version 6 of Windows, if you call this function in a lower version the method will throw an UnsupportedOperationException.If this option is not supported you must use the FolderBrowserDialog class.

      Parameters:
      selectedFolders - Selected folders
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - system version not supported

    • isSelectedFolders

      public boolean isSelectedFolders()
      returns true if the option to select folders is enabled.
      Returns:
      is enabled option
      See Also:
      • setSelectedFolders(boolean)
